page.title: 19SETTLEMENTS NEAR STOW
page.content: Stow Parish is very small, including only the original built-up area. In the first edition of Domesday Book it comes under Maugersbury which is now just a hamlet 1km from Stow. It has a Manor House and several farms and covers a much larger area than Stow Parish. The Swells, at the foot of the slope to the west of Stow are two more independent Parishes. Each has an ancient Parish Church, but they share their Parish Priest with Condicote and Longborough. Lower Swell is larger than Upper Swell with a shop, a school, a pub and a small hotel. There is a blacksmith whose work is well known over a very wide area. Some new houses are being built in Lowere Swell, but they will probably be too expensive for ordinary young couples.
